title: How to Make 'Rotten Apple' Punch (Halloween)

steps.headline: Make grape Kool-Aid according to package directions.
Put 1 to 2 gummy worms in each hole of an ice cube tray.
steps.description: Pour the grape Kool-Aid into the ice cube tray, covering the gummy worms.

steps.headline: Place the ice cube tray in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow to sit until the ice cubes are frozen. These form the rotten apples.

steps.headline: Make lime Kool-Aid according to package directions.
steps.description: Refrigerate for the same time as the ice cubes are freezing.

steps.headline: Make the drinks.
steps.description: Pour the lime Kool-Aid into glasses. Remove the ice cubes from the freezer. Add a few ice cubes (also known as rotten apples) into each glass. As the ice cubes melt, the drink will change color and look like rotten apple punch.

steps.headline: Pour apple cider into the small dishes or containers.
steps.description: Fill to 1/2 an inch/1 centimeter (0.4 in) from the top, then leave space.

steps.headline: Add one drop of green food coloring and two drops of red food coloring per dish.
Arrange three gummy worms per dish.
steps.description: Hang each gummy worm slightly over the edge, with most of the worm in the liquid still. Space the worms at even intervals around the dish.

steps.headline: Put the dishes carefully into the freezer.
Pour sparkling apple cider into the punch bowl.
Remove the rotten apple confections from the freezer.
steps.description: To free them from the dish, sit the base of the dishes in a shallow sink or bowl of warm water. They will start to melt quickly, so don't leave them in there too long.

steps.headline: Tip the rotten apples into the punch.
steps.description: They will immediately start to float.

steps.headline: Add some more gummy worms around the edge of the punch bowl for garnish.
steps.description: The rotten apple cider punch is now ready for serving.

text: Make grape Kool-Aid according to package directions.  Put 1 to 2 gummy worms in each hole of an ice cube tray. Pour the grape Kool-Aid into the ice cube tray, covering the gummy worms. Place the ice cube tray in the freezer. Allow to sit until the ice cubes are frozen. These form the rotten apples. Make lime Kool-Aid according to package directions. Refrigerate for the same time as the ice cubes are freezing. Make the drinks. Pour the lime Kool-Aid into glasses. Remove the ice cubes from the freezer. Add a few ice cubes (also known as rotten apples) into each glass. As the ice cubes melt, the drink will change color and look like rotten apple punch. Pour apple cider into the small dishes or containers. Fill to 1/2 an inch/1 centimeter (0.4 in) from the top, then leave space. Add one drop of green food coloring and two drops of red food coloring per dish. Stir to combine well. Arrange three gummy worms per dish. Hang each gummy worm slightly over the edge, with most of the worm in the liquid still. Space the worms at even intervals around the dish. Put the dishes carefully into the freezer. Leave to freeze solid. Pour sparkling apple cider into the punch bowl.  Remove the rotten apple confections from the freezer. To free them from the dish, sit the base of the dishes in a shallow sink or bowl of warm water. They will start to melt quickly, so don't leave them in there too long. Tip the rotten apples into the punch. They will immediately start to float. Add some more gummy worms around the edge of the punch bowl for garnish. The rotten apple cider punch is now ready for serving.
